text:
54yo with PMH NASH, LBP, depression, anxiety, HTN, hypercholesterolemia
   presents with increasing confusion, worsening hepatic encephalopathy;
   in ED, treated for hyperkalemia with K+ 6.7 and intubated for airway
   protection. Transfer to MICU for further care
   Hepatic encephalopathy/NASH
   Assessment:
   Pt with NASH, remains intubated for airway protection, sedated on low
   dose propofol; AMS complicated by pt
s primary language Portuguese, pt
   restless in bed; LFTs remain elevated but at baseline; on Bairhugger
   Action:
   Continues on Lactulose q2h, attempting to assess mental status; US at
   bedside, marked site for tap; abx for ? SBP; propofol increased to
   20mcg/kg/min; attempted PS this am
   Response:
   No stooling with lactulose yet, soap suds enema given, remains
   restless, unable to ascertain if pt is able to follow commands d/t
   language barrier, pt not tracking; BP stable on propofol; o/u continue
   marginal; OGT output guiac+ with small clots; did not tolerate PS
   trial, became tachy to 110
s; US showing large volume ascites
   Plan:
   Trend WBC
s, continue abx, follow-up culture data, continue mech vent
   until mental status improves, may require liver bx, ? repeat tap; KUB
   this am, holding lactulose for now
